intro: Romulea bulbocodium var. pylia, commonly known as the Pylia bulbous orchid, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous roots and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of violet or purple flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but requires specific care to thrive.
